sub_topic: Calculating the molar mass of inorganic compounds
message_1: What is the molar mass of sodium chloride (NaCl)? Show step-by-step calculations in determining the answer.
message_2:
To calculate the molar mass of sodium chloride (NaCl), we need to find the molar mass of each element (sodium and chlorine) and then add them together. 

Step 1: Find the molar mass of sodium (Na)
The molar mass of sodium can be found on the periodic table. Sodium has an atomic mass of approximately 22.99 g/mol.

Step 2: Find the molar mass of chlorine (Cl)
The molar mass of chlorine can also be found on the periodic table. Chlorine has an atomic mass of approximately 35.45 g/mol.

Step 3: Add the molar masses of sodium and chlorine together
Molar mass of NaCl = (molar mass of Na) + (molar mass of Cl)
Molar mass of NaCl = 22.99 g/mol + 35.45 g/mol
Molar mass of NaCl = 58.44 g/mol

So, the molar mass of sodium chloride (NaCl) is approximately 58.44 g/mol.
